meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being rigid or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: The stiffness of the old wooden door made it hard to open.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended exercises to help with the stiffness in my joints.
meanings.sent3: The stiffness of the new shoes made the little girl walk like a robot.
meanings.sent4: The stiffness of the rules in the strict school reminded me of a prison.
meanings.sent5: The stiffness of the frozen lake warned us not to step on it.

meanings.definition: The resistance of an object to bending or deformation.
meanings.sent1: The stiffness of the metal rod prevented it from bending easily.
meanings.sent2: The stiffness of the fabric helped the dress keep its shape.
meanings.sent3: The stiffness of the rubber band made it snap back when stretched.
meanings.sent4: The stiffness of the tree branch resisted the strong wind.
meanings.sent5: The stiffness of the cardboard box made it difficult to fold.

meanings.definition: The state of being difficult to bend or move.
meanings.sent1: The stiffness of the frozen ground made it hard to dig.
meanings.sent2: The stiffness of the old book's spine made it challenging to open.
meanings.sent3: The stiffness of the cat's tail showed its annoyance.
meanings.sent4: The stiffness of the rusty lock made it impossible to turn.
meanings.sent5: The stiffness of the door handle indicated it was locked.
